channel.title: Parkour
channel.description:
anyone heard of it? its basicly the art of movement. going from a to b as fast and effecient as possible. i have been doing it for maybe 8-9 months. and i have got semi-good. watch one of my videos, or all of them :)
[b]watch in HQ:[/b] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QEmhpg5S6og
here is a video of one of the founders of parkour, david belle. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x98jCBnWO8w

item.title: Parkour
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:1, topic:269660”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=355772.msg2723116#msg2723116 date=1238114741]
Is it just me, or does Parkour seem a little stupid? I don’t really understand the point, or what you get out of it? I’m not having a dig at it, it just doesn’t make sense to me. However, I cannot comment due to my lack of experience of it. Looks like just an adrenaline rush.
[/quote]
It would come in handy when running from the police.[/quote]
Ah, that’s true.

Read full topic

item.title: Parkour
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“hat trix, post:8, topic:269589”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=355772.msg2723116#msg2723116 date=1238114741]
Is it just me, or does Parkour seem a little stupid? I don’t really understand the point, or what you get out of it? I’m not having a dig at it, it just doesn’t make sense to me. However, I cannot comment due to my lack of experience of it. Looks like just an adrenaline rush.
[/quote]

you stay in shape, it isnt as easy as it looks lol, and if im not mistaking it was used as military tactics to get through your invironment, saying there is no point for parkour is like saying, no point for gymnastics, or no point for baseball, ect…

jesus can walk on water, david belle can swim through land.

simple put :0[/quote]
I never said there was no point of it, what I was trying to say basically is - I don’t understand what the point is, other than enjoyment and addiction of adrenaline. But I’m not one to talk, if you enjoy it, do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Parkour
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:6, topic:269589”]Is it just me, or does Parkour seem a little stupid? I don’t really understand the point, or what you get out of it? I’m not having a dig at it, it just doesn’t make sense to me. However, I cannot comment due to my lack of experience of it. Looks like just an adrenaline rush.[/quote]The fundamentals of Parkour is to get from Point A to Point B as quick and efficiently as possible. If you would search the MITB forums, I’ve posted many times about Parkour and am getting back into it again since it’s spring again. I have a few friends that practice with me from time to time.

It is also a really good fitness exercise.



These two videos are probably my favourite Parkour compilations on YouTube at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: Parkour
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

Yz85Racer:

Is it just me, or does Parkour seem a little stupid? I don’t really understand the point, or what you get out of it? I’m not having a dig at it, it just doesn’t make sense to me. However, I cannot comment due to my lack of experience of it. Looks like just an adrenaline rush.

you stay in shape, it isnt as easy as it looks lol, and if im not mistaking it was used as military tactics to get through your invironment, saying there is no point for parkour is like saying, no point for gymnastics, or no point for baseball, ect…

jesus can walk on water, david belle can swim through land.

simple put :0
